  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Inventory Account Officer",
  "description": "Brands and Trade Limited is a unique distribution and logistics company in Lagos poised to disrupt the distribution landscape. We have a team of thinkers and doers, some of whom are supply chain and distribution experts who share a singular commitment to the job done. This includes our investors and directors who are not active in day-to-day operations.

Brands and Trade has a track record of achievements, successes and capacity enhancement in retail distribution thereby opening opportunities for new partnerships and growth. We constantly invest in technology, building the right infrastructure, and deploying bespoke tools and applications for superior inventory management. This is in line with our commitment to delivering the highest standards of service to every customer.

Brands and Trade distributes many world-class brands and products across five categories: Wine and Spirits; Beverages (alcoholic and non-alcoholic); Hygiene, Home, and Personal Care; Oil, Cereals and Grains; and Animal and pet care. We are a benchmark distribution partner for many multi-billion-naira businesses in Nigeria including International Breweries (Ab-InBev), Monument Distillers, Grand Cereals and Oils Limited and 2Sure (Life Care Division of SevenUp Bottling Company Ltd).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Account Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Ajah / Abraham Adesanya - Lagos
Reports To: Inventory Manager / Finance Manager
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Inventory Account Officer is responsible for managing and reconciling the financial aspects of inventory records.
	This includes ensuring that all inventory movements are accurately recorded and that stock balances remain consistent between the physical warehouse and the accounting system.
	The officer will work closely with warehouse, supply chain, sales, and finance teams to ensure seamless inventory flow, accurate reporting, and full compliance with company policy.
	The role also involves processing invoices, managing accounts payable/receivable, and maintaining accurate financial records.


Key Responsibilities
Inventory Accounting &amp; Reporting:


	Maintain accurate records of inventory transactions in the accounting system.

Capacity Planning Engineer Job at Airtel Nigeria




        
    

        
        Airtel Nigeria (Airtel Networks Limited) is a leading telecommunications services provider in Nigeria headquartered in Lagos, the commercial nerve-centre of Nigeria. The telco ranks amongst the top four mobile service providers in terms of subscribers with a customer base of more than 39.8 million. The company's product offerings include 2G, 3G and 4G wireless services, mobile commerce and enterprise services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Capacity Planning Engineer

Job Identification: 587
Job Location: Lagos
Job Schedule: Full time

Purpose of the Job
     

            
    




	The purpose of the role is to ensure that the network capacity across all the technologies (2G, 3G, 4G and 5G) is designed to support current and forecasted traffic.
	Also, maintaining an accurate database of radio access resources at all times and managing network capacity using innovative and automated processes to guarantee consistency and data reliability.


Responsibilities
Design & Monitor UTRAN Interfaces:


	Design the UTRAN interfaces based on traffic forecast
	Monitor the traffic trend and ensure to keep system within the target utilization threshold
	Recommend cost effective solutions


Capacity Planning:


	Follow up with core network and transport planning to ensure end-to-end capacity planning is maintained
	Ensure that utilization of all the technology layers is efficiently managed.
	Understand the HW and SW capabilities of the telecom equipment.
	Carry out capacity plan for special events and sudden traffic increase.


Technology evolution:


	Ensure balanced traffic loading between different technologies
	Plan and design future-proof solutions.
	Apply insights from geo-location platform, Facebook and other sources to proactively forecast and plan network capacity.
	Maintain the HW and SW roadmaps tracker and ensure that capacity enhancement features are sourced and deployed at the right time.


Educational Qualifications 


	University Degree in Electronic / Electrical, Computer or Telecommunication Engineering
	Proven professional training in Telecommunications sector


Relevant Experience:


	5 years of experience in 2G, 3G, 4G and 5G Radio Engineering
	Experience in automation is an added advantage
	Excellent in using excel and other Microsoft applications
	Hands-on experience operating performance management tools and dimensioning tools.
